text: Thomas Sawyer Murphy (May 31, 1925 â€“ May 25, 2022) was an American broadcast executive. He was chair and chief executive officer of Capital Cities / ABC, Inc. until 1996. He co-bought American Broadcasting Company in 1986 for $3.5 billion. Murphy was born in New York City. Murphy died on May 25, 2022 at his home in Rye, New York six days before his 97th birthday. ==References== Category:1925 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Businesspeople from New York City Category:American chief executives
title: Thomas S. Murphy
